com.example.ARmirrorS.Server.ImgProc.Utils

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.ARmirrorS.Server.ImgProc.Utils.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends Object

    Class Utils

    Class Utils contains multiple general utility function used for camera interaction as well as for frame processing:-

    1. Getting Camera Supported Resolutions. 2. Getting Average HSV hue value of an image from Hue Channel. 3. Morphing the final mask for better quality. 4. Mask the frame with processed image to display to user. 5. Send the masked or pixlated image to client if streaming has started.

    Since:
    2019-12-05
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Yussuf Khalil, Daniel King, ykhalil2@illinois.edu, dking32@illinois.edu

    • Method Detail

      • getCameraResolutions

        public static int[][] getCameraResolutions(org.opencv.android.CameraBridgeViewBase mCameraView,
                                           String cameraID)
        Called to populate the menu items with the supported camera resolutions, in case the user decides to change it later on.
        Parameters:
        mCameraView - reference to OpenCV cameraView Object.
        cameraID - Front or Back Camera ID.
        Returns:
        Array of all supported Resolutions by Camera.

      • getHistAverage

        public static double getHistAverage(org.opencv.core.Mat hsvImg,
                                    org.opencv.core.Mat hueValues)
        Get the average hue value of the image starting from its Hue channel histogram.
        Parameters:
        hsvImg - the current frame in HSV
        hueValues - the Hue component of the current frame
        Returns:
        the average Hue value

      • morphImage

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat morphImage(org.opencv.core.Mat mask,
                                             double kernelSize)
        Function to reduce noise on a provided mask to perform morphological eroding and dilation to eliminate noise.
        Parameters:
        mask - the current masked frame to be morphed
        kernelSize - kernel Size used to erode and dilate mask
        Returns:
        black and white mask or masked RGB image

      • returnDisplayImage

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat returnDisplayImage(Frame currentFrame,
                                                     org.opencv.core.Mat currentMask)
        Function to return an image to display on screen based on choice of Camera View Mode chosen by user. ONLY In case of masked or pixelated view mode: we will send the processed image to the client if he has requested the server to start streaming. Otherwise we will mask the gray scale image or the color frame and displays it to the screen. For Pixelated image we will also create a rectangle (region of interest) to show the user what will be sent to the client which is a cropped version of the viewable frame.
        Parameters:
        currentFrame - the current frame being processed with all its channels
        currentMask - the current processed frame
        Returns:
        black and white mask or masked RGB image

      • createROI

        private static org.opencv.core.Rect createROI(org.opencv.core.Mat image)
        Function mainly Downscale the image to a maximum of 32 pixels (based on user desire) and resize it, then Convert the cropped masked image of black and whites to an array to send to client. Normalize values of the array to bytes from -45 degree to 45 degrees. Every pixel value from 0 - 255 will be converted to an angle from -45 to 45 deg. where 127 will be equal to zero. in case we have triangle shapes create a new bytebuffer to accommodate the extra flipped triangles and fillers at left and right of each row of tiles. total tiles per row will be equal to senArray.length * 2 + noTiles. if we are streaming then go ahead and broadcast the byte buffer message to all clients.

        Parameters:
        image - Matrix representing the current processed frame
        Returns:
        cropped rectangle to superimpose on displayed image (server side)
